intro: Coreosma americana, commonly known as the American coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a versatile addition to native gardens. Its nectar attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
